intro: Proustia berberidifolia, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. Proustia berberidifolia is an important plant in desert ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in sandy habitats.
